snippet: Inside an oversize aquarium, the artist Lars Jan demonstrates how a rising sea level could affect everyday life in his installation, “Holoscenes.”
abstract: Miami Journal; artist Lars Jan has brought installation Holoscenese to Miami Dade College to coincide with annual Art Basel event in large part to underscore impact climate change will have on people's lives across globe; installation is human aquarium in which water pours in and drains out, in order to illustrate effects of rising sea levels on everyday life.
lead_paragraph: Inside an oversize aquarium, the artist Lars Jan demonstrates how a rising sea level could affect everyday life in his installation, “Holoscenes.”

headline.print_headline: In Performance Art, a Climate Change Tale
headline.main: Water as a Climate-Change Gut Punch in a City Defined by an Ocean
